Module defining the Base class.

class trical.classes.potential.AdvancedSymbolicPotential(N, expr, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: trical.classes.potential.Potential

Object representing a symbolically defined potential that need not be the same for all ions.

Parameters

expr – Symbolic expression of the potential.

class trical.classes.potential.GaussianOpticalPotential(focal_point, power, wavelength, beam_waist, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: trical.classes.potential.Potential

Object representing a potential caused by a Gaussian beam.

Parameters

  • focal_point (numpy.ndarray) – Center of the Gaussian beam.

  • power (float) – Power of Gaussian beam.

  • wavelength (float) – Wavelength of Gaussian beam.

  • beam_waist (float) – Waist of Gaussian beam.

Keyword Arguments

  • m (float): Mass of ion.

  • Omega_bar (float): Rabi frequency per root intensity.

  • transition_wavelength (float): Wavelength of the transition that creates the optical trap.

  • refractive_index (float): Refractive index of medium Gaussian beam is propagating through.

first_derivative(var)[source]¶

Calculates the first derivative of the potential with respect to a variable.

Parameters

var (str) – Derivative variable.

Returns

Function corresponding to the first derivative of the potential with respect to the derivative variable.

Return type

types.FunctionType

class trical.classes.potential.OpticalPotential(intensity_expr, wavelength, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: trical.classes.potential.SymbolicPotential

Object representing a general optical potential.

Parameters

wavelength (float) – Wavelength of the optical potential.

Keyword Arguments

  • m (float): Mass of ion.

  • Omega_bar (float): Rabi frequency per root intensity.

  • transition_wavelength (float): Wavelength of the transition that creates the optical trap.

  • refractive_index (float): Refractive index of medium Gaussian beam is propagating through.

class trical.classes.potential.Potential(phi, dphi, d2phi, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: trical.classes.base.Base

Object representing a general potential.

Parameters

  • d2phi (types.FunctionType) – Function that takes two strings representing the derivative variables and outputs the function corresponding to the derivative of the potential with respect to the derivative variables.

  • dphi (types.FunctionType) – Function that takes a string representing the derivative variable and outputs the function corresponding to the derivative of the potential with respect to the derivative variable.

  • phi (types.FunctionType) – Function representing the potential.

update_params(**kwargs)[source]¶

Updates parameters, i.e. params attribute, of a Potential object.

Keyword Arguments

  • dim (float): Dimension of the system.

  • m (float): Mass of an ion.

  • N (float): Number of Ions.

  • q (dict): Charge of an ion.

class trical.classes.spinlattice.SimulatedSpinLattice(ti, mu, Omega, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: trical.classes.spinlattice.SpinLattice

Object representing a spin lattice system simulated by a trapped ion system

Parameters

  • ti (trical.classes.trappedions.TrappedIons) – A trapped ion system.

  • mu (numpy.ndarray) – Raman beatnote detunings.

  • Omega (numpy.ndarray) – Rabi frequencies.

interaction_graph()[source]¶

Calculates the interaction graph of the spin lattice simulated by the trapped ion system.

Parameters

trical.classes.trappedions module¶

class trical.classes.trappedions.TrappedIons(N, *ps, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: trical.classes.base.Base

Object representing a system of trapped ions.

Parameters

N (int) – Number of ions.

equilibrium_position(opt=<function dflt_opt>, **kwargs)[source]¶

Function that calculates the equilibrium position of the ions.

Parameters

opt (types.FunctionType, optional) – Generator of the appropriate optimization function for finding the equilibrium position, defaults to trical.misc.optimize.dflt_opt

Returns

Equilibrium position of the ions.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

mode_ion_coupling()[source]¶
normal_modes()[source]¶

Function that calculates the normal modes of the system.

Returns

  • w (numpy.ndarray): Normal mode frequencies of the system.

  • b (numpy.ndarray): Normal mode eigenvectors of the system.

plot_equilibrium_position(**kwargs)[source]¶
plot_normal_modes(**kwargs)[source]¶
plot_principle_axis(**kwargs)[source]¶
principle_axis(tol=0.001)[source]¶

Function that calculates the principle axes of the system.

Returns

  • x_pa (numpy.ndarray): Principle axes of the system.

  • w_pa (numpy.ndarray): Normal mode frequencies of the system.

  • b_pa (numpy.ndarray): Normal mode eigenvectors of the system in the principle axis coordinate system.

update_params(**kwargs)[source]¶

Updates parameters, i.e. params attribute, of a TrappedIons object.

Keyword Arguments

  • dim (float): Dimension of the system.

  • l (float): Length scale of the system.

  • m (float): Mass of an ion.

  • q (dict): Charge of an ion.
